translation: (Now begins the description of Arresting Jarasandh and then releasing him)

gurmukhi: jau lig fyrn Awvq Qo qb lau iek Awie sMdyS sunwXo ] Dwm clo biRjnwQ khw qum pY sij sYn jrwisMD AwXo ]
transliteration: Jau Lag(i) Deran Aavat Tho Tab Lau Ik Aae Sandesh Sounaayo|| Dhaan Chalo Brijnaath Kahaa Toum Pai Saj(i) Sain Jaraasindh Aayo||
translation: As soon as Krishna arrived in his tent, someone come to deliver the message, “O Krishna ! why are going to your home? On that side Jarasandh is coming, bedecked with his army;”

gurmukhi: AwXo suin kY bqIXw iqh kI mn mY Bt Aaurn qRws bFwXo ] sXwm BnY jdubIr hlI Aiq hI mn Awpn mY suK pwXo ]1926]
transliteration: Ooyo Soun(i) Kai Bateeyaa Tih Kiman Mai Bhat Auran Traas Badhaayo|| Syaam Bhanai Jadoubeer Haliat(i) Himan Aapan Mai Soukh Paayo||1926||
translation: Hearing these words, the minds of the warriors became fearful; but Krishna and Balram were pleased at this.1926.

gurmukhi: eyeI bwqY krq Bt inj pur phucy Awie ] BUp bYT buDvMq sB Apny lIey bulwie ]1927]
transliteration: Eibaatai Karat Bhat Pur Pahouche Aae|| Bhoop Baith Budhvant Sabh Apne Leee Bulaae||1927||
translation: Absorbed in this talk, all the warriors reached in the city; the king Uggarsain then called tall his wise confidents.1927.

gurmukhi: jyr Gno dlu isMD jrw niRp AwXo hY kop AbY kih k`eIXY ] sYn Gno ieh ky sMig hY jo pY juDu krY nhI jwq bc`eIXY ]
transliteration: Jor Ghano Dal(u) Sindh Jaraa Nrip Aayo Hai Kop Abai Kah(i) Kaeeeeyai|| Sain Ghano Eh Ke San(i) Hai Jo Pai Judh(u) Darai Nahijaat Bachaeeyai||
translation: The king said, ”Jarasandh is coming in fury with his huge army and we cannot save ourselves with fighting;

gurmukhi: kY ieh ko sB jwie imlY pur Cwf nhI AnqY kau isD`eIXY ] bwq kupyc bnI sB hI ien bwqn qy Xo khw Ab k`eIXY ]1928]
transliteration: Kai Eh Ko Sabh Jaae Milai Pur Chhaad Nahiantai Kau Sidhaeeyai||1928||
translation: Either we should go to receive him or leaving the city, run away to some other place; this is a very serious matter; nothing will result from mere talk now.”1928.

gurmukhi: kIno iehY ibcwr pur qij kY AnqY bsih ] nw qr fwrY mwr jrw isMD BUpiq pRbl ]1929]
transliteration: Keeno Ihai Bichaar Pur Taj(i) Kai Antai Basah(i)|| Naa Tar Ddarai Maar Jaraa Sindh Bhaapat(i) Prabal||1929||
translation: Ultimately it was decided to leave the city and abide at some other place, otherwise the powerful king Jarasandh would kill all.1929.

gurmukhi: kIjY soaU ibcwr jo BwvY sB jnn mn ] Apny icqh ibcwr bwq n kIjY Twn hn ]1930]
transliteration: Keejai Sooo Bichaar Jo Bhaavai Sabh Janann Man|| Apne Chitah Bichaar Baat Na Keejai Thaandhan||1930||
translation: Only that decision should be taken, which is liked by all; merely the persistence of the mind should not be accepted.1930.
